qas.question: Among the emerging Protestant and Evangelical churches what are clergy moving away from?
A Cassock and Surplice typically consisted of?

answers.text: full length Old English style surplice

qas.question: Which movement was representative of the ecumenical past?
Clergy are moving away from the alb and toward what?

plausible_answers.text: the alb and chasuble, but also cassock and surplice

qas.question: Clergy are trending towards the black Geneva gown and away from what?
What is typically full lengthy and Old Geneva in style?
What were some Celtics involved in?

context: Among the paleo-orthodox and emerging church movements in <b6_0>Protestant and evangelical churches<b6_0/>, in which some Presbyterians are involved, clergy are moving away from the traditional <a0_0><b3_0>black Geneva gown<b3_0/><a0_0/> to such vestments as <b4_0>the alb and chasuble, but also cassock and <b5_0>surplice<b5_0/><b4_0/> (typically a <a1_0>full length Old English style surplice<a1_0/> which resembles the Celtic alb, an ungirdled liturgical tunic of the old Gallican Rite), which some, particularly those identifying with the <a2_0>Liturgical Renewal Movement<a2_0/>, hold to be more ancient and representative of a more ecumenical past.
